semantic_title: Complete External Cause Code Documentation Requirements
section_path: Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > a. General External Cause Coding Guidelines > 3) Use the full range of external cause codes

content.full_text: Use the full range of external cause codes to completely describe the cause, the intent, the place of occurrence, and if applicable, the activity of the patient at the time of the event, and the patient's status, for all injuries, and other health conditions due to an external cause. (Evidence: pg no: 88, L34-L35)
content.summary: Complete external cause documentation requires codes for cause, intent, place of occurrence, activity, and patient status when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 88, L34-L35)
key_concepts: Full range of external cause codes required (Evidence: pg no: 88, L34)
Must describe cause and intent (Evidence: pg no: 88, L35)
Include place of occurrence when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 88, L35)
Include patient activity when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 88, L35)
Include patient status when applicable (Evidence: pg no: 88, L35)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use full range of external cause codes to completely describe all relevant circumstances (Evidence: pg no: 88, L34-L35)
detailed_rules.explanation: Complete external cause coding requires multiple code types to fully capture the circumstances of injuries and external cause conditions (Evidence: pg no: 88, L34-L35)
detailed_rules.applies_to: All injuries and health conditions due to external causes

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify the cause of the injury or condition
Step 2: Determine the intent (accidental, intentional, etc.)
Step 3: Document place of occurrence if applicable
Step 4: Include activity code if applicable
Step 5: Add patient status code if applicable
